briefdescription.para: NVS write flags.

detaileddescription.para: The following flags can be or'd together and passed as a bit mask to NVS_write.
Erase write flag.
If NVS_WRITE_ERASE is set in the flags passed to NVS_write(), the affected destination flash sectors will be erased prior to the start of the write operation.

briefdescription.para: Validate write flag.

detaileddescription.para: If NVS_WRITE_PRE_VERIFY is set in the flags passed to NVS_write(), the destination address range will be pre-tested to guarantee that the source data can be successfully written. If NVS_WRITE_ERASE is also requested in the write flags, then the NVS_WRITE_PRE_VERIFY modifier is ignored.

briefdescription.para: Validate write flag.

detaileddescription.para: If NVS_WRITE_POST_VERIFY is set in the flags passed to NVS_write(), the destination address range will be tested after the write is finished to verify that the write operation was completed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Special NVS_lock() timeout values.

detaileddescription.para: NVS_lock() Wait forever define

briefdescription.para: NVS_lock() No wait define.
Special NVS_Attrs.regionBase value.

detaileddescription.para: This region is not directly addressable (e.g.,: SPI flash region)
The NVS_Attrs.regionBase field returned by NVS_getAttrs() is set to this value by the NVSSPI driver to indicate that the region is not directly addressable.
Common NVS_control command code reservation offset. NVS driver implementations should offset command codes with NVS_CMD_RESERVED growing positively
Example implementation specific command codes: #defineNVSXYZ_CMD_COMMAND0NVS_CMD_RESERVED+0 #defineNVSXYZ_CMD_COMMAND1NVS_CMD_RESERVED+1
Common NVS_control status code reservation offset. NVS driver implementations should offset status codes with NVS_STATUS_RESERVED growing negatively.
Example implementation specific status codes: #defineNVSXYZ_STATUS_ERROR0NVS_STATUS_RESERVED-0 #defineNVSXYZ_STATUS_ERROR1NVS_STATUS_RESERVED-1 #defineNVSXYZ_STATUS_ERROR2NVS_STATUS_RESERVED-2

briefdescription.para: Successful status code returned by: NVS_control(), NVS_read(), NVS_write(), NVS_erase(), or NVS_lock().

detaileddescription.para: APIs returns NVS_STATUS_SUCCESS if the API was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Generic error status code returned by: NVS_control(), NVS_erase(), or NVS_write(),.

detaileddescription.para: APIs return NVS_STATUS_ERROR if the API was not executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by NVS_control() for undefined command codes.

detaileddescription.para: NVS_control() returns NVS_STATUS_UNDEFINEDCMD if the control code is not recognized by the driver implementation.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by NVS_lock()

detaileddescription.para: NVS_lock() will return this value if the timeout has expired

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by NVS_read(), NVS_write(), or NVS_erase()

detaileddescription.para: Error status code returned if the offset argument is invalid (e.g., when offset + bufferSize exceeds the size of the region).

briefdescription.para: An error status code.

detaileddescription.para: Error status code returned by NVS_erase() if the offset argument is not aligned on a flash sector address.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by NVS_erase() and NVS_write()

detaileddescription.para: Error status code returned by NVS_erase() if the size argument is not a multiple of the flash sector size, or if offset + size extends past the end of the region.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by NVS_write()

detaileddescription.para: NVS_write() will return this value if NVS_WRITE_PRE_VERIFY is requested and a flash location can not be changed to the value desired.

briefdescription.para: A handle that is returned from the NVS_open() call.
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_close().

A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_getAttrs().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_init().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_open().

memberdef.argsstring: )(NVS_Handle handle, size_t offset, void *buffer, size_t bufferSize)

memberdef.argsstring: )(NVS_Handle handle, size_t offset, void *buffer, size_t bufferSize, uint_fast16_t flags)

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_write().

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_lock().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of NVS_unlock().
NVS Global configuration.

detaileddescription.para: The NVS_Config structure contains a set of pointers used to characterize the NVS driver implementation.
This structure needs to be defined before calling NVS_init() and it must not be changed thereafter.

briefdescription.para: Function to close an NVS_Handle.

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()

briefdescription.para: Function performs implementation specific features on a given NVS_Handle.

parameterdescription.para: An NVS_Handle returned from NVS_open()
A command value defined by the driver specific implementation
An optional read or write argument that is accompanied with cmd

simplesect.para: Implementation specific return codes. Negative values indicate unsuccessful operations.

briefdescription.para: Erase size bytes of the region beginning at offset bytes from the base of the region referenced by the NVS_Handle.

simplesect.para: Erasing internal flash on most devices can introduce significant interrupt latencies while the erase operation is in in progress. The user may want to surround certain real-time critical code sections with NVS_lock() and NVS_unlock() calls in order to prevent uncoordinated flash erase operations from negatively impacting performance.

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()
The byte offset into the NVS region to start erasing from (must be erase sector aligned)
The number of bytes to erase (must be integer multiple of sector size)
Success.
If offset is not aligned on a sector boundary
If offset exceeds region size
If size or offset + size exceeds region size, or if size is not an integer multiple of the flash sector size.
If an internal error occurred erasing the flash.

briefdescription.para: Function to get the NVS attributes.

detaileddescription.para: This function will populate a NVS_Attrs structure with attributes specific to the memory region associated with the NVS_Handle.

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()
Location to store attributes.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the NVS module.

simplesect.para: The NVS_config structure must exist and be persistent before this function can be called. This function must also be called before any other NVS APIs.

briefdescription.para: Function to lock the NVS driver.

detaileddescription.para: This function is provided in the event that the user needs to perform some flash related operation not provided by the NVS driver API set or if the user simply needs to block flash operations for a period of time.
For example, the interrupt latency introduced by an uncoordinated flash write operation could interfere with some critical operation being performed by the application.
NVS_lock() prevents any other thread from initiating read, write, or erase operations while the user is performing an operation which is incompatible with those functions.
When the application no longer needs to block flash operations by other threads, NVS_unlock() must be called to allow NVS write or erase APIs to complete.

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()
Timeout (in milliseconds) to wait, or NVS_LOCK_WAIT_FOREVER, NVS_LOCK_NO_WAIT
Success.
If timeout has expired.

briefdescription.para: Open an NVS region for reading and writing.

parameterdescription.para: Index in the NVS_Config table of the region to manage.
Pointer to a parameter region. If NULL, default parameter values will be used.

simplesect.para: A non-zero handle on success, else NULL.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the NVS_Params struct to its defaults.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to NVS_Params structure for initialization.

memberdef.argsstring: (NVS_Handle handle, size_t offset, void *buffer, size_t bufferSize)
memberdef.name: NVS_read

briefdescription.para: Read data from the NVS region associated with the NVS_Handle.

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()
The byte offset into the NVS region to start reading from.
A buffer to copy the data to.
The size of the buffer (number of bytes to read).
Success.
If offset + size exceed the size of the region.

briefdescription.para: Function to unlock the NVS driver.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows NVS write and erase operations to proceed after being temporarily inhibited by a call to NVS_lock().

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()

memberdef.argsstring: (NVS_Handle handle, size_t offset, void *buffer, size_t bufferSize, uint_fast16_t flags)
memberdef.name: NVS_write

briefdescription.para: Write data to the NVS region associated with the NVS_Handle.

simplesect.para: Writing to internal flash on most devices can introduce significant interrupt latencies while the write operation is in in progress. The user may want to surround certain real-time critical code sections with NVS_lock() and NVS_unlock() calls in order to prevent uncoordinated flash write operations from negatively impacting performance.

parameterdescription.para: A handle returned from NVS_open()
The byte offset into the NVS region to start writing.
A buffer containing data to write to the NVS region.
The size of the buffer (number of bytes to write).
Write flags (NVS_WRITE_ERASE, NVS_WRITE_PRE_VERIFY, NVS_WRITE_POST_VERIFY).
Success.
If the internal flash write operation failed, or if NVS_WRITE_POST_VERIFY was requested and the destination flash range does not match the source buffer data.
If offset + size exceed the size of the region.
If NVS_WRITE_PRE_VERIFY is requested and the destination flash address range cannot be change to the values desired.
If NVS_WRITE_ERASE is requested and offset is not aligned on a sector boundary

simplesect.para: This call may lock a region to ensure atomic access to the region.

briefdescription.para: Non-Volatile Storage driver interface.

detaileddescription.para: The NVS module allows you to manage non-volatile memory. Using the NVS APIs, you can read and write data from and to persistent storage.

Each NVS object is used to manage a region of non-volatile memory. The size of the region is specified in the device specific driver's hardware attributes. A sector is the smallest unit of non-volatile storage that can be erased at one time. The size of the sector, or sector size, is hardware specific and may be meaningless for some non-volatile storage hardware. For flash memory devices, the region must be aligned with the sector size. That is, the region must start on a sector boundary. Additionally, the overall size of the region must be an integer multiple of the sector size.
This section provides a basic usage summary and a set of examples in the form of commented code fragments. Detailed descriptions of the APIs are provided in subsequent sections.

The NVS driver interface provides device independent APIs, data types, and macros. The following code example opens an NVS region instance, writes a string into it, then prints the string after reading it back into a local buffer, and also prints the string from its directly addressable location in flash memory.

para.heading: Erasing, writing, reading an NVS region

detaileddescription.para: The following code example opens an NVS region instance, erases the first sector of that region, writes a string into it, then prints the string after reading it back into a local buffer. If the string is directly CPU addressable (i.e. not in SPI flash), the string is printed from its location in flash memory.
Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
Details for the Typical NVS region operations example code above are described in the following subsections.

In order to use the NVS APIs, the application is required to provide device-specific NVS configuration in the ti_drivers_config.c file. The NVS driver interface defines a configuration data structure, NVS_Config.

The application must declare an array of NVS_Config elements, named NVS_config[]. Each element of NVS_config[] is populated with pointers to a device specific NVS driver implementation's function table, driver object, and hardware attributes. The hardware attributes define properties such as the NVS region's base address and size, Each element in NVS_config[] corresponds to a NVS instance, and none of the elements should have NULL pointers.

You will need to check the device-specific NVS driver implementation's header file for example configuration. Please also refer to the ti_drivers_config.c file of any of the examples to see the NVS configuration.
NVS_init() must be called before any other NVS APIs. This function calls the device implementation's NVS initialization function, for each element of NVS_config[].

Opening a NVS requires four steps:
Optionally create and initialize a NVS_Params structure.
Fill in the desired parameters.
Call NVS_open(), passing the index of the NVS region in the NVS_Config structure, and the address of the NVS_Params structure.
Check that the NVS_Handle returned by NVS_open() is non-NULL, and save it. The handle will be used to read and write to the NVS you just opened.

simplesect.para: Each NVS index can only be opened exclusively. Calling NVS_open() multiple times with the same index will result in an error. The index can be re-used if NVS_close() is called first.

detaileddescription.para: All NVS APIs are globally thread safe. Consequently, only one write, erase (or read in the case of SPI flash) operation is allowed to be performed at a time, even for distinct NVS regions. Threads initiating new NVS writes or erases will block until any current operation completes.

When writing to or erasing internal flash, interrupts must be disabled to avoid executing code in flash while the flash is being reprogrammed. This constraint is met internally by the driver. User code does not need to safeguard against this.

Care must be taken by the user to not perform flash write or erase operations during latency critical phases of an application. See the NVS_lock() and NVS_unlock() API descriptions for more information.
